body_html:
we dont have any mechanism that has nngraph -> pytorch. You can read the nngraph model manually, convert it to torch7's nn model and then save it to disk.
Alternatively, you can construct same model architecture in PyTorch, and only save the parameters of the nngraph model to disk and load those parameters into PyTorch and copy into this carefully constructed new model.
body_text:
we dont have any mechanism that has nngraph -> pytorch. You can read the nngraph model manually, convert it to torch7's nn model and then save it to disk.
Alternatively, you can construct same model architecture in PyTorch, and only save the parameters of the nngraph model to disk and load those parameters into PyTorch and copy into this carefully constructed new model.
body:
we dont have any mechanism that has nngraph -> pytorch. You can read the nngraph model manually, convert it to torch7's `nn` model and then save it to disk. 
Alternatively, you can construct same model architecture in PyTorch, and only save the `parameters` of the `nngraph` model to disk and load those parameters into PyTorch and copy into this carefully constructed new model.
